messages.content: I've really been enjoying 0 cost deck hermit
I should try that.
taking a lot of glares, golden bullets, feints, and luck of the draws
its weird because hermit really doesn't feel like the type of class to have 0 cost synergies
and it does really well against status and curse as well
Since it draws through them for basically free (as long as you don't have bronze statue, which I will skip on hermit)
I´ve also found 0 cards also work well with helping manipulate hand position for Dead On
It's a 0 cost block card with a bit of bruise
I'll normally take at least one for the 0 cost block part
Yeah the 0 cost cards on hermit all are pretty good, and LotD is fun as well
And they also work well with Roulette, 0 costs cards are easier to play after the spending the 2 energy
It's my favorite going from 1-2 cards in hand to 10
Yeah but I never take roulette tbh
Hermit already has good enough early game damage and the secondary effect kinda sucks

A: hermit doesn't have the discard synergies that silent has
B: it costs 2 whole energy, so you often only get to play 1-2 cards afterwards anyway
Roulette does has done a good amount of work for me in curse decks with Shadow Cloak, where I just want to keep redrawing the curses for block
I don't run curse decks, the most I'll do with that is grudge. Otherwise no.
It can work well to create a block engine in late game fights sometimes
Last time I ran a "curse deck" I duplicated my covet twice so I had 3 covet+
i wonder if Dark Brick is gonna write an essay about this card since they requested it

I often use Shadow Cloak to block late game, Its often a struggle for Hermit to block against act 3 bosses and the heart
vote brass tacks

easy early bolster access, plus enchridion?

it becomes power skill attack attack skill inferno. Back to back attack is really damn bad.

and you often don't need to rush to get that 1 strength and block, and when you do... <tricky's bolster rod>

Idk I rarely run that, maybe I'm the odd one out
I'll take time warp sometimes, but I almost never take <incineration> and I've taken it even less since it's been rare

and it scales with strength

and bludgeon sucks.
D:
I already don't play him. I just thought I'd try to get the 0-cost synergy. Then the only 0-cost card I got in both runs were two Feints (almost in a row).

It also won't scale with strength, and not all fights will end turn 3. For example you could have a situation where you can't apply sb on turn 1, or bad draw and you have to wait until turn 6 to kill

you should be ending almost every hallway on turn 3 period as a thing

Starter Relic / The Hexaghost / Downfall

The first time you Ignite a Ghostflame each turn, gain 4 **Block** :p_block:.

messages.content: 19 block turn 2
how does that counter sencheese?
or more
you take way less chip
That's a check, not a counter.
It helps but I would not consider it a counter
I consider it a counter in the same way that soulburn + spirit brand trivializes lagavulin
since neither scales with str dex
Man it's always interesting talking to blue guy, we both play hexa in VERY different ways

See, against Lagavulin, that IS a counter.
"You take slightly less damage" isn't countering, otherwise any block card is a counter.
I can definitely get defensive about my opinions, but seeing people approach the character in a very different way is cool
A card that says "Exhaust drawn statuses and do a thing" is a counter to Sentries.
nah spirit brand is block that doesn't rely as hard on specific cards so the dazeds hurt less, plus you can nearly full block the turn 2 which is the hardest turn of the sentries fight IMO
I'd say hexa has a really good matchup vs. laga because the sleep turns allow you to stack sb
not because it isn't effected by the -strength and dex. That is a contributing factor, but the sleep turn is much more important for hexa.
well yeah the sleep turns are obvious though
immediately so
Honestly hot take, but sentries are the act 1 elite I fear most as hexa if I have a decent deck.
nob is the sketchiest since a really bad t1 draw screws you the hardest
it's not too bad

Spirit Brand helps, absolutely. But you still need to deal with the many Dazed keeping your attacks from reaching your hand. And if you're playing optimally, you're losing cards due to Afterlife, so your deck is smaller by the time you shuffle and thus gets impacted by Dazed even harder.
I'd say hexaghost has postive matchups against every act 1 elite
but nob is the hardest
But the turn 3 kill can just absolutely murder it before it can scale off your skills
I know but you need it turn 1, which isn't hard, but you can just draw all defends
and afterlife skills don't give it strength. I've had runs where I draw a ghost shield turn 1, that blocks turn 2 and it dies turn 3.
yeah I know
It's a really weird matchup where on the surface it looks like nob would counter hexa, but the more you look into the mechanics the more the opposite is true
and now back to hermit

I don't think nob is a HARD fight, I think hexaghost does incredibly well against all 3 elites, but nob is the worst matchup, even though it is positive, just because of the turn 1 soulburn requirement
but yeah hermit
---wormhole to the other side----
lol
ok ok ok

Nic and Blue guy challenge: don't bring up hexa

Difficulty: impossible
a LOT of typing going on
Kiku is paragraph prepping

This compares pretty favorably to deflect, though silent has better access to card draw and dexterity, and has relevant card spam synergies. You could think of it as a strange iron wave variant, blocking for 3 and dealing 4-6 damage if you follow it up with several attacks. It's certaintly a card I have difficulty taking in act 1, as it does poorly into both tri-sentries (too little block, artifact counters the bruise) and gremlin nob (low impact skill, plus you already have covet as a low impact skill in the starter deck). I more frequently pick it up in act 2, especially if I missed the 4th energy, and definitely If I have a runic pyramid. Can be used to help clear the act 1 boss, but you are going to need more damage scaling than just this.
did not consider runic pyramid before
having <horror> makes this a lot better

embeds.title: Horror
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Apply 3 (5) **Bruise** :p_bruise: to ALL enemies.
**Bruise** :p_bruise: does not wear off this turn.

messages.content: In the two runs I played today, I didn't get ANY interesting card synergies. Or useful synergies.
Tbh I think horror is a little too overcentralizing in bruise decks. A bruise deck with horror is just better than one without.
Especially with how it works with <brawl>

embeds.title: Brawl
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 2 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

At the start of your turn, apply 3 (5) **Bruise** :p_bruise: to ALL enemies.

messages.content: and playing multiple copies straight keeps scaling it even higher
I think horror is the card that makes or breaks bruise decks. A good horror draw can win a fight, and poorly drawing it can screw your damage for the fight.
And as I mentioned, the best way to remedy this is to have multiple copies of horror. I think horror either needs to be more rare, or exhaust.
Would be interesting to see it at common and exhaust, maybe upgrade to retain

It provides some block, and temporary damage scaling, which is nice utility, but like iron wave, often won't be enough of either to really get the job done on it's own. Definitely becomes more interesting with lots of card draw. I do find myself taking other scaling damage and mitigation options over feint pretty often, you really want something like oddly smooth stone, horror, maintenance+, ink bottle, or letter opener to make this become more than the sum of its parts. Can also be useful to help cheaply remove artifact stacks from enemies, but you are usually already good at that because of glare and memento, and you also don't have any really juicy debuffs to apply to enemies (see talk to the hand for watcher), your best debuff is flash powder+. The upgrade is notably quite good, if you play even two attacks to follow it up, you are getting better than a +3, and that's on a 0 cost card as well. Also plays nicely with dead-on, letting you move your hand around to reposition, and letting your snapshot block for more.

this card has seen better days, rip 3 bruise 4 block feint. Its like alright now, its sorta like a flex that also has some block attached. Hermits card draw is mostly bursts though so your not playing this as many times as you would with a card like deflect. It gets better with horror of course and if you took pistol whip as one of your early damage cards.
Feint used to be 4(5) block and 2(3) bruise, was changed in March 2022 to be 4(6) block, block was brought down to 3(5) in August 2022, and that's where it remains to this day
